key_points: Claims that Joe Biden's small inauguration crowd size proves Donald Trump won the 2020 election are false.
Social media posts comparing crowd sizes at Biden's and Trump's inaugurations sparked controversy.
Official restrictions due to the COVID-19 pandemic limited attendance at Biden's inauguration.
The claim ties to baseless allegations of widespread voter fraud in the 2020 presidential election.
Biden's inauguration crowd size was smaller due in part to pandemic restrictions encouraging virtual participation.
Members of Congress were given significantly fewer tickets to Biden's inauguration to distribute, to limit crowd size.
Increased security measures, including National Guard presence and subway station closures, were implemented around the inauguration.
District of Columbia Mayor Muriel Bowser urged people to watch the inauguration virtually following the Capitol riot on January 6.
Election officials and courts, including the Supreme Court, have found no evidence of widespread voter fraud in the 2020 election.
President Joe Biden won the 2020 election with more than 7 million votes over Donald Trump.
spokespersons: Tony Allen (Chief Executive Officer, inaugural committee)
